headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Letdown
summary: The Nasdaq composite led indexes lower, dropping 2.3%, as chip stocks including Nvidia and Broadcom were hit hard.  Flight disruptions might continue for a while, and investors are still awaiting word from federal agencies on when to expect backlogged economic data.

headline: Nancy Pelosi Is Retiring up 595%, but She’s Still Holding on to These 3 Stocks
summary: Nancy Pelosi announced her retirement last week. She has been a leading voice in Congress for decades, and her term will end in January 2027. She’s currently holding on to many stocks, with Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL), and Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) being the latest buys. headline: Cisco Shares Surge After AI-Fueled Outlook Exceeds Estimates
summary: Cisco also increased its earnings forecast, which similarly topped analysts’ predictions.  The outlook sparked fresh optimism that Cisco can benefit from booming AI spending.  Demand for Cisco’s technology highlights the need for secure networking “as customers move quickly to unlock the potential of AI,” Chief Executive Officer Chuck Robbins said in a statement.

headline: US stocks drop as Nvidia and AI superstars keep weakening
summary: The U.S. stock market is slumping on Thursday as Nvidia and other superstars swept up in the mania around artificial-intelligence technology keep weakening.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 363 points, or 0.8%, from its own record set the day before, while the Nasdaq composite was down 1.7%, as of 11:15 a.m. Eastern time.  Nvidia was the heaviest weight on the market after the chip company lost 3.8%.
